Key Match Events: Marcus Stoinis smashed the winning SIX as Australia secured its first victory in the ICC World Cup 2023.
Mitchell Marsh and Josh Inglis led Australia towards their first victory in the ICC Men's World Cup 2023.
Dilshan Madushanka clinched some wickets to keep the chase tight.
Dilshan Madushanka clinched his 3rd wicket to depart Marnus Labuschagne.
Josh Inglis smashed 50 and looked wonderful today under pressure.
Sri Lanka's quick fielding ensured that Mitchell Marsh is run-out.
Dilshan Madushanka dismissed David Warner and Steve Smith early.
Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Perera added 125 runs in 22 overs.
Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc took two wickets each.
Pre-Game Insights: Pat Cummins emphasized the need for Australia to start winning quickly and treat every game like a final.
Kusal Mendis highlighted the need for Sri Lankan bowlers to adapt quickly to Indian conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Cummins expressed that the mood in the camp has been fantastic despite the losses and emphasized the need to turn things around quickly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at Ekana stadium is likely to offer more support to the bowlers under lights.
The weather conditions in Lucknow were set to be hazy with a low probability of rain during the day but higher at night.
